Visualize the number of observations per sample.

Source: R/depths_barplot.r
depths_barplot.Rd

Visualize the number of observations per sample.

depths_barplot(biom, rline = TRUE, labels = TRUE, trans = "log10", ...)

Arguments

biom

A matrix, simple_triplet_matrix, or BIOM object, as returned from read_biom. For matrices, the rows and columns are assumed to be the taxa and samples, respectively.

rline

Where to draw a horizontal line on the plot, intended to show a particular rarefaction depth. Set to TRUE to show an auto-selected rarefaction depth or NULL to not show a line. Default: TRUE.

labels

Show sample names under each bar. Default: TRUE.

trans

Y-axis transformation. Options are "log10" or NULL. Default: "log10".

...

Additional parameters to pass along to ggplot2 functions. Prefix a parameter name with either p., r./h., or s. to ensure it gets passed to (and only to) geom_point, hline, or geom_smooth, respectively. For instance, p.size = 2 ensures only the points have their size set to 2.

Value

A ggplot2 plot. The computed data points will be attached as attr(p, 'data').

See also

Other plotting: adiv_boxplot(), adiv_corrplot(), bdiv_biplot(), bdiv_boxplot(), bdiv_heatmap(), plot_heatmap(), rare_corrplot(), rare_multiplot(), taxa_boxplot(), taxa_corrplot(), taxa_heatmap(), taxa_stacked()

Examples

    library(rbiom)
    
    depths_barplot(hmp50, rline=TRUE)
